item.title: AppBinding CRD
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. AppBinding What is AppBinding An AppBinding is a Kubernetes CustomResourceDefinition(CRD) which points to an application using either its URL (usually for a non-Kubernetes resident service instance) or a Kubernetes service object (if self-hosted in a Kubernetes cluster), some optional parameters and a credential secret. To learn more about AppBinding and the problems it solves, please read this blog post: The case for AppBinding.

item.title: PerconaXtraDB CRD
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. PerconaXtraDB What is PerconaXtraDB PerconaXtraDB is a Kubernetes Custom Resource Definitions (CRD). It provides declarative configuration for standalone PerconaXtraDB (Percona Server) and Percona XtraDB Cluster in a Kubernetes native way. You only need to describe the desired configuration in a PerconaXtraDB object, and the KubeDB operator will create Kubernetes objects in the desired state for you. PerconaXtraDB Spec As with all other Kubernetes objects, a PerconaXtraDB needs apiVersion, kind, and metadata fields.

item.title: PerconaXtraDBVersion CRD
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. PerconaXtraDBVersion What is PerconaXtraDBVersion PerconaXtraDBVersion is a Kubernetes Custom Resource Definitions (CRD). It provides a declarative configuration to specify the docker images to be used for PerconaXtraDB deployed with KubeDB in a Kubernetes native way. When you install KubeDB, a PerconaXtraDBVersion custom resource will be created automatically for every supported PerconaXtraDB versions. You have to specify the name of PerconaXtraDBVersion object in .
